intro: Dimorphostachys schaffneri, commonly known as the Schaffner's dimorphostachys, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as an erect shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. The fruit is a small, dry capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
